intro: Banksia sphaerocarpa var. violacea, commonly known as the purple banksia, is a shrub or small tree native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical or spiky flower spikes, which are typically violet or purple in color. The plant produces woody cones that contain seeds, a feature typical of the Proteaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal regions. The flowers attract nectar-feeding birds and insects, making it an important component of local ecosystems.
